intro: Amyema rhopalanthes, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, star-shaped flowers that bloom during the winter months. The plant has a shrub-like appearance with dense, evergreen foliage. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Amyema rhopalanthes is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking floral display.
